captions.text: hold on friend
were you about to kill that spider?
spiders are important, just imagine what the world would look like
if all the spiders disappearing... firstly
there be a whole lot more insects.  1 individual spider eats approximately
2,000 insects a year
insects that would otherwise devour crops
and destroy our food supply, leading to our ultimate demise
more importantly we wouldn't have spiderman, It'd be like
caterpillar man or something... spiders are an
integral part of the ecosystem but that is not the end to their benefits
spiders are an invaluable food source for many animals
specifically various types of birds and lizards, not to mention all the animals that
eat
those birds and lizards, if we got rid of spiders we'd lose countless amazing species
some cultures even use spider silk
to create fishing nets by encouraging the spiders to spin webs
between two sticks of bamboo, maybe those fish don't like spiders but
whenever, everyone knows fish are liars anyway. research has shown that spider venom
could potentially be utilized to control and treat various diseases
without spiders we'd lose countless possible medicines
humanity as we know it
be overrun by Insects and
starvation
bugs would take over the world, it would be a literal
livinging nightmare

title: What If All The Spiders Disappeared?

comments.author: LeJuanCa

comments.text:
+Johnny Jesus
Unless you go back in time, shrink, and jump into your brain, you probably 
aren't literally living your nightmare.
comments.author: LeJuanCa

comments.text:
+LeJuanCa What if you literally live a nightmare that you had the night 
before? =P
comments.author: Johnny Jesus

comments.text:
+Johnny Jesus
"Living nightmare" is an idiom. You can't ever put "literally" before an 
idiom, unless dogs and cats are falling from the sky, or if people start 
talking about a potato that is hot, or if you pay someone a cent to tell 
you what they are thinking, or if you give your limbs to buy something 
expensive, or-
comments.author: LeJuanCa

comments.text:
+LeJuanCa Though the phrase "living nightmare" means a nightmare (Something 
you'd only imagine to be in a nightmare, basically. Never in real life.) 
that you are actually living through. Not a nightmare that is alive.
comments.author: Johnny Jesus

comments.text:
+Johnny Jesus
Well nightmares aren't exactly alive, so
comments.author: LeJuanCa

comments.text: +LeJuanCa The usage seemed grammatically correct.

ha ha. yeah. the older houses are the worst with that shit. and basements. 
I was never much of a painter but I did some here and there. I mostly did

but when I worked on that 3 story Victorian, it was a spider paradise. we 
did the exterior and a lot of the old wooden siding needed to be fixed, 
replaced, or nailed down before sanding and painting.

and there were so many spiders, webs, and eggs between, under, and on the 
siding.
it was such a shitty job lol

comments.author: TheMinecraftDragon97

comments.text:
Thats why i take every spider i find at home and let em go outside in the 
grass or something. Plus, i really like spiders because theres a lot more 
reasons they are beneficial to the planet. Over 90% of the spider species 
that live in the United States are not even harmful to humans. Only Black 
Widows, Brown Recluses, and Mouse Spiders are venomous enough to kill a 
human, and even then, usually only young kids, the elderly or the sick 
people. Besides that we have antivenins. And Brown Recluse venom actually 
can't kill you, death would only come if the bite area became infected.﻿
